Go to the lectures, do practice problems, and engage yourself and you'll be fine. If you don't like this class you might want to reconsider your major
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: The premier finance professor at KSU. He artfully brings finance to its most basic and simple level so it's accessible to everyone. If you struggle with math, Bray is your guy. He will walk you, step-by-step, through every problem you see. The department keeps this class very surface-level, but this is on the department, not Dr. Bray!

Dr. Bray is by far the best professor I have ever taken at KSU. He is very direct which some people may not like, but he makes his expectations clear and attainable. He is very approachable and is always willing to help. He has made me love finance. You will work really hard in his class to do well but he makes it fun! TAKE HIM!!

Very boring guy. Super dry material, a kind of off sense of humour. Very reliant on powerpoint and often makes corrections to them, instead of fixing them before class. He isn't the worst professor I've had, but there are better ones. 25 question tests which make up 60% of your grade. Missing one question on a test is .6 points off your final grade
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: His personality is fun at first, but it does grate on you as the semester drags on. Moderately difficult material but mediocre lectures, doesnt really seem all that interested in the material. Quizzes are overly difficult as are tests. Overall mediocre.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I don't understand why there are so many other positive ratings on David Bray, he is not easy, is quite condescending, and is easily offended. BEWARE, he is going to make you work hard for your grade and will not show much leniency. You get 4 exams and 6 quizzes all IN CLASS, and that determines your entire grade. And they are not easy. Be Warned.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Great teacher. If you go to class and do the practice problems its hard to get anything less than a B
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is very straight to the point and I love the quizzes. His quizzes are easy and help you out with your grade. His tests are hard because ( Finance) , expect for test 2 was extremely hard. His sarcastic behavior gets a little annoying and disrespectful at times. Just sit quiet and do good on your work and you will be fine .

Bray is a fantastic teacher! He gives us several examples, and walks us step by step through problems. Do the assigned problems at the end of the chapter, they will help on tests. He allowed us to have a 3x5in index card on tests. His dazzling (sarcastic af) personality made finance interesting.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: If you can't tolerate foul language and "real world" talk, he isnt for you. I thought it was hilarious and fantastic. He will be very real with you in terms of grading, rules and expectations. And don't show up late, not even by 10 seconds.. he won't let anyone open the door for you. Despite this, study hard, show up, take notes, he is GREAT

First Off, ratemyprofessor shouldn't have taken away his chili pepper, rude. Second, GREAT professor. Great TEACHER, amazing ability to actually teach students information at a pace and level of understanding that any college student should be able to pass as long as effort is put in by the student. Don't expect to pass if you don't show up & work.

If you don't handle the real world well, don't take this class. Dr. Bray makes it clear no extra credit will be given, along with no bumping of grades at the end of the semester (even if you have an 89.99). There are 4 in-class tests and 6 quizzes with the lowest one dropped. Tests worth 60% of your grade, quizzes worth 40%.

The best professor I've had during MBA program!! He is sarcastic & funny and very passionate about finance. He teaches in a way that makes sense & is fun. I have never taken a FIN class (healthcare degrees) & was scared to take it, but I'm really enjoying his class & love his lectures. Very fair professor. Would happily take another class with him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr Bray was a solid choice, and I'd take him again. Grade is based on 8 quizzes + 4 exams (noncomprehensive final). Tests aren't easy, but he definitely gives everyone the tools necessary to do decently on them. Him going off-topic during lectures was a mild annoyance, but otherwise, they were fine; very knowledgeable about the content.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Amazing prof. Attendance isn't required but highly recommended bc he gives helpful info. 4 tests which you can use a notecard on and 6 quizzes but only keeps top 5 scores. He does go on tangents and can be very sarcastic but if you have a good sense of humor and are a "reasonable human being" (his favorite phrase) you'll do just fine in this class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you want an A you better work for it. I got a B but I learned a lot. He explains things as best as he can. There are quizzes that add up to 40% of your grade. The rest is test. He hates group projects so that is a + if you do too. If you got a sensible sense of humor you will not like him. If I was a Finance major I'd take as many classes w/him.

comment: Amazing professor. Do the work and pay attention in class and youll make an A
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Took him during a Maymester and he honestly made the two weeks go by super fast! He was one of the funniest professors I ever had at KSU. Just study and practice the problems he gives you and you will pass his tests! He only curves tests if the entire class needs it, and he doesn't' round up your grade. He also takes attendance everyday.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: I took Dr. Bray in a Maymester and although it was 2 weeks of a lot of hard work, I would 100% recommend him. He is the funniest professor I've ever had & actually made sitting in class for 5 hours a day enjoyable. Clear grading criteria & I love his teaching style. The class is tough, but it's finance. Probably the best finance teacher at KSU

One of the more challenging classes in the MBA program Bray teaches at a level that raises KSU standards to what I imagine are comparable to an Emory or GA Tech level. This class requires regular attendance. The syllabus states quiz and test dates. I highly encourage doing all the suggested homework until you have high competency to receive an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Bray may seem strict, however, there is a method to his madness. Clear grading criteria from day one. Plan to attend every class and take plenty of notes. You will need the book for the homework, I highly suggest you do the homework. Not an easy A, plan to study for each test & quiz. Beware the stock valuation chapter. Overall, great professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: professor bray is an amazing finance professor, he teaches with passion and knows what he is talking about. textbook is not necessary but i did use it as a guide which helped me a lot. he drops one quiz grade and there is 4 tests total. he is funny and some people get his jokes and some don't, but he makes class enjoyable!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: No homework, only grades are quizzes and tests. If you like knowing where you stand at all times, this is the guy. Takes attendance, will call you out if you're on your phone. Not an easy class, but no bs like group projects which I really appreciated. Cares about Finance which is nice.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: For what it's worth, Dr. Bray is an intelligent professor that wants his students to succeed. However, his sense of humor, personality and no-nonsense attitude can make him difficult to approach. Don't take him if you dislike professors that suffer from overabundance of personality. PS: Be careful what you say about him on social media.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: If you want to learn, take this course. If you want a free A, take someone else. He teaches the material perfectly, explains how it can be applied in your life, and tells you exactly what you need to do to receive an A. The material isn't easy, it is finance. But, he's helpful. I would highly recommend taking him if you're not a child.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Amazing professor. Took him last semester. He is very clear on what he expects, and it is very reasonable, too. Do the practice problems he assigns. They aren't turned in, but they are KEY to succeeding in this course. He is very helpful, funny, a great teacher, and is attractive (just a bonus lol). Loved him, and this course.

I never typically do these rate my professors things but this professor I definitely had to. While this was definitely one of the most challenging classes I have ever had at KSU this professor knows what he is doing. Yes, sometimes he teaches way to fast but overall he is a great professor and wants the best for you. He is also hilarious! Good luck
Amazing professor. Be ready to study. Quizzes are easy, test requires a good amount of understanding. Truly cares about his students and is readily available.

Dr. Bray is a great professor, as straightforward as they come. Go to class, print off the lecture slides, and take notes and you will have everything you need to make an A. Hilarious to listen to but if you're a snowflake you might get offended. Suck it up he is one of the best professors to take at Kennesaw State if you want to learn anything.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He wants you to succeed through hard work! He will treat you with the same kindness and fairness as any other student, which is nice. No playing favorites. You'll be intimidated on the first day but rest assured, he may seem like a "tin man" but whether he likes it or not, he's got a heart! Attend class, go to office hours, and do the homework.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Tests are tough

comment: One of the best teachers I've had. Go to class, print out the notes, pay attention and do the practice problems. He is hilarious and I enjoyed going to his class. One of the hardest classes you will take but he makes it easy to understand. Do literally everything he tells you to do and you will make a good grade!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Hilarious professor. You'll love the sarcasm all semester. Hardest class I've taken(material heavy), but would take him again! This class consists of tests and quizzes based completely off lectures. Practice the end of chapter problems he assigns and study slides to make an A. He knows the material and knows how to explain it. Don't need book.

Dr. Bray is a really good professor. Hes very clear on his expectations, and he follows through with his word. His exams are straightforward, and he prepares you well for them. I struggle with any sort of math, and Im doing pretty well in his class. If you put in the effort, an A is VERY achievable. Great guy, good class. Id take him again.

He is a cool guy that makes us laugh. However, his tests are crazy hard. The average was an F on the last test before the curve. I would not take him again for that reason. 4 exams 6 quizzes. Lowest quiz dropped.

This is a good teacher but do not expect any handouts. You will have to work for your grade but that is what you should expect to do anyway. If you miss class you will lose the clarity that he provides in the powerpoints. Finance is difficult so it isn't easy but he is very clear and will help you if you truly need it and are willing to ask.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I loved taking Bray and I plan to take him again for Investments. He's v funny, and while it's true he can be a hardass (does NOT bump your grade up) he's v clear about his expectations and rules from day one. In my opinion, he's more than willing to help you as long as you're reasonable and work hard. Also he showed us pictures of his dog.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I have him now. He is intimidating but helpful if you ask. Do all of the practice problems. Quizzes are easy and sometimes in the book. Do not ever text in class. Today he embarrassed someone bad making them leave. He drops the lowest quiz. Rent the book for cheap off Amazon. Do not miss class because you will be lost on the calculator.

Have nothing bad to say about Bray! He's a very clear lecturer and will explain concepts very concisely. You want to show up to class because, unusually, he is actually clearer than most books. He will take directly what he teaches in class and insert them into his tests. Wish I could take him for another course!

He's overall a great guy that's just tough on people. He doesn't allow any technology which, as someone who gets distracted easily,  I really respect. He also doesn't want anyone to be late. He gets you ready for the real world. 7 quizzes, lowest one dropped, 3 tests. Nail the quizzes and the class will be a breeze. Also, he looks like John Cena.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Bray is funny as well as very matter of factly. His humor and down to earth personality helps to lighten the mood of what can come off as a dry, tough subject for those who aren't finance majors such as myself. Want to pass with atleast a B? Pay attention in class, BE ON TIME, get a study group, interact (he likes that), learn your calculator!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He literally reads the "math" off the PPT slides and if you ask him to clarify anything, he either says no or answers sarcastically like "what do you think". His tests are hard because they aren't like the practice problems and throws in random questions. The only easy part were the quizzes. You'll love his  "special" personality.

Great teacher.   I enjoyed attending his class, it was so informative and professional, and I've learned a lot. It was fun too.  Fair in grading and clear grading criteria from day 1 in class. Humor is part of Dr. Bray's teaching, which makes it an easy class and not dull.   You've got to manage your time well in tests. Study hard and it is easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He is sort of a sassy kind of guy if you do something that bothers him in class, so be aware of his pet peeves. I thought his class was good overall 4 exams a few quizzes. Quizzes are all conceptual and are based on the PPT slides. His exams can seem hard so come prepared, study his practice problems and PPT slides and you should be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: Clear and concise, very knowledgeable and has a dry sense of humor.

Prof. Bray is straight forward with his rules. He will freak out like a maniac if he see's a phone. He will give you a B IF you receive a 89.999 and there is no way of fighting it. If you love finance, you will enjoy his class. He has 4 test. The final is not cumulative but hard as hell! OH YEAH, HE IS VERY OPINIONATED!
Great professor!  Hilarious and jokes around with students to make the course fun.  4 exams and 6 quizzes but drops the lowest quiz grade.

No extra credit. If you have an 89.9, you won't get rounded up. Pay attention in class and you'll make an A. Kind of a meanie in class but super nice if you catch him at his office. Best business professor I've had.

One of the best professors I've taken at Kennesaw State. Good sense of humor, which helps with a dry topic like finance. 6 Quizzes (lowest one dropped) and 4 tests. No calculation on quizzes and tests are a mix of calculation and conceptual questions. He'll gladly help you if you're having any issues. Would definitely take again.

one of the best professors I have had.  He is clear and easy to understand.  A PHD with a 6th grade vocab, his words.  He is helpful and willing to help during and after class.  He is a bit sarcastic, but it makes class enjoyable.  I would take him..  6 quizes, 5 are graded and 4 tests. He makes the material easy, while making you feel smarter.

Dr. Bray gives 6 quizzes and counts the top 5 grades. His quizzes are entirely conceptual - no math, and they are announced prior to the class in which they occur (they aren't pop quizzes). The final is not comprehensive, it is just another test. He is very fair, and makes the material really enjoyable.

He is a great teacher and extremely clear of his expectations of his students. If you are a slacker, don't take his class. He will help but you have to actually put forth effort.   Side note- he is hilarious and sarcastic. Might offend some people but I enjoy it
Go to class!! He is willing to help if you do your part.   Oh he hates cell phones. Do not ever text in class

Clear from day one.  Covers all material quickly and expects you to do some work outside of class.  An A is absolutely attainable if you do some work on your own.  Dr. Bray is more than willing to meet with you during office hours, or otherwise if need be.  Quizzes are announced the class before.  No surprises at all!

Great professor. Cut and dry personality, but if you do your work, you can get an A. Must go to class to understand the material and studying is super important! Was willing to help if needed, just doesn't allow you to be a slacker.

Anyone saying Bray is difficult is cray cray. Go to class, takes notes and make your cheat sheet for the test and this class is the easiest A you'll get. Bray explains everything clearly, is always available during his office hours and is downright hilarious. He made me want to go to class because of how entertaining he made it. Will take him again

I am so glad I took Dr. Bray. He was extremely helpful and I learned a lot! I am not that good with mathematical courses, but his class wasn't all that difficult as he was very clear on how to do things. GO TO CLASS! That extra 3 points he gives got me a B. I would definitely take him again. He was very entertaining as well.

Had him for Investments. Good professor, very clear, fair. 5 quizzes worth 40% of your grade, 4 tests worth 60%. 3 additional points added to final grade for attendance/active participation. Class material isn't terribly hard, but you ABSOLUTELY MUST study (especially for quizzes), or you will not do well.

Very difficult class if you're unfamiliar with Finance or haven't taken similar courses in a while, but Dr. Bray does an excellent job of making the material easier to understand and even occasionally enjoyable. Definitely need to get the book for supplementary learning and for homework, and make sure to study for quizzes. Overall great professor.

This class is hard if youdon't study. Take the quizzes seriously! They count for 40% of your grade. If you miss class you will have trouble keeping up. He is also very entertaining in class. Take him!
He's great! He teaches you everything you need to know to make a good grade. YOU MUST STUDY AND GO TO CLASS OR IT WILL SHOW IN YOUR GRADES. Take him if you are willing to study.

Excellent professor.  He explains things fully, and gives you everything you need to succeed in the course.  That does not mean he spoon feeds you.  He teaches upper level and graduate finance courses.  By the time you get to these classes, you should know how to feed yourself.

This man. He's amazing. The material gets challenging but he's an awesome teacher and always willing to help. The people who say he's not helpful may be put off by his sense of humor/personality but if you put that aside and ask him for help, he definitely will. I wish I could take him for every class!

Class and exams are structured. He is clear and to the point. The class is very conceptual so read the book. Test are fair. A is definetly attainable. Free points for attendance. Highly recommend him.

I was worried about taking finance but it ended up being one of the best classes. He is very clear on what is expected and his powerpoints and the book help with understanding. It is not an easy subject and class can be exhausting but if you study the power points, do the calculations and read the chapter you'll be good. Definetly recommend!

Very straightforward in running class, fair in terms of grading and dealing with students.  Study the slides and pay attention in class and you will be fine.  Allows a notecard to be used on exams that can contain formulas, definitions, etc.

Prof Bray is a really good teacher.  Class presentation and grading standards are well thought out and logical.  Take good notes and fully understand concepts and a student should do well. Overall, a top notch instructor.
Outstanding teacher.  His personality makes it easy to sit through a three hour class.  Quizzes and Tests cover exactly what is reviewed in class.  Taking him again next semester for Investments.

Very willing to help if you are struggling.  He can come off as a bit brash but it is pretty amusing and helps to lighten the tone of a hard subject.  GO TO CLASS. If you skip a lot, you will be completely lost.  The notecard for the exam is very helpful.  Not easy by any means but it is doable.

Anyone who says an A in this course isn't attainable is dead wrong. It is a lot of work but if you put the time into it you will be fine. Demanding course but it is an upper level course after all. Learned more here than in any other class. Dr. Bray is a fantastic professor.

As good as it gets. He is the most structured, organized, and to the point guy. Follows syllabus to the T. I will take another class with him. Very fair. If ppl are bashing him its cuz they aren't studying and want free A. For exam do practice problems and read text. For quiz review ppt. And give free points for attendance. Thorough professional.

The person beneath me is wrong. #1: There is no extra credit.  Bray knows what he his talking about, and teaches you to use the calculator, unlike some professors. To the person beneath me: Crack is WACC.

Bray gets some kind of enjoyment from failing people. He is extremely intimidating. All lectures are completely based off of PowerPoint. So dry. Do whatever you can to find another professor. The extra credit and cheat sheets mean nothing if you don't understand the material.
Professor Bray doesn't want to help. He seems to teach just for the paycheck. If you don't understand a concept, too bad. Be careful!!!
Dr Bray keeps his lectures interesting for a relatively dry subject. Not an easy A, but completely possible with a little work. Allows a cheat sheet on the tests. Also very easy on the eyes.

Difficult class but he makes it fun. He ll try to scare you the first day, but he's a very intelligent guy with a good sense of humor. Hes always available if you need help. I went to his office a lot for help. And he's very attractive which many of the girls enjoyed in the class.

This was my second to last Fin class and I have seen all. The best finance professor at KSU. He is a no nonsense kind of professor but overall fair.  Great sense of humor and some interesting life stories or moments happen to be shared with class, which makes this heavy class easy to attend.  Do not kid yourself, you have to study hard for an A.

Difficult class and concepts. Doesn't explain too well and moves pretty quickly. Does allow have a sheet, one side, as a cheat sheet on the exam. I never understood what was going on. I'd just do the cheat sheet, run through the problems the night before an exam, and cross my fingers. I pulled out with an A.

He was clear, direct and to the point. The class material was interesting and informative. I liked how he related the material to the real world of finance and not just useless theories. I learned alot about finance and thought that both the class and prof. were excellant!

He was enthusiastic and explained the material in a clear, thorough way. He was direct and straight to the point and related the class material to the real world of finance and not just theories. The lectures and class material was very interesting to listen to as well. Learned alot and thought that the prof. and class were overall excellant.
Great Prof. Lectures are engaging. Very knowledgeable. Tests were curved...quizzes weren't that bad. 89.9 is a B so you have to earn an A to get it.
Dr. Bray is a great professor! He will teach you everything you need to know. Tests fluctuate in difficulty. Quizzes are easy. Plus, he is extremely good looking. Take him!

Direct. To the point. Clear about expectations. Easy to understand grading system. No group project. Study hard for the tests and don't act like a fool and you should do well. What's not to like? Easily the best professor I have had at KSU.

If you want an easy A, Do Not Take this class. However, if you wanna learn a good deal about Invesment I definitely recomend the class. Attend all classes so you don't fall behind and you get your 3pts. Make Good use of Exam Sheet. Hint:type your sheet with small fonts; must like math in order to enjoy class, otherwise you will be misserable.

Dr. Bray will kill you, if you don't pay attention. He's a great guy and his class is actually fun. Pay attention and you'll do fine. Give him BS and you'll leave. The guy knows what he's doing, most of the time. Give him a lottery ticket and you might be liked more. Take the class!

Dr. Bray is an excellent professor. Having never had a Finance class before - I didn't know how would I fair. Dr. Bray makes the materail engaging and I found myself to be more than sucessful. But YOU MUST STUDY.  Dr. Bray's class structure is straight forward - what he tells you the first class of the semester holds true throughout the semester.

Dr. Bray is an excellent teacher who loves finance. He provides good study material so an A is not out of the question. Make sure you go to class. If you are offended by pg-13 language I don't recommend him.

Bray is very fair.  If you disrupt his class, he will ask you to leave, plain and simple. He will not tolerate your BS in class.  However, if you behave and pay attention, you will actually learn something and earn yourself an A.  His sense of humor is a little twisted, but it makes the dry nature of the class more palatable!

I agree with others that have rated before me. He is awesome, funny, straightforward and enthusiastic. I enjoyed him very much, and learned a lot from him. He is always out there if you need any kind of help. He is more like a friend rather than teacher. I suggest all the student of finance to take him.
Very straight forward..Make sure you do the chapter problems and pay attention in class and you will do fine.. No group projects which is a plus...
Funny guy, keeps class interesting. 5 quizzes and 5 tests, material is extremely easy as long as you review his powerpoints and do the problems.

He is a very cool guy, young, and sometimes even funny. However, he tries to hard to be a "frat boy".  That is why he is hard to deal with and 0 lenient.  I do recommend him just because he makes it interesting other wise i wouldn't tell you to give him a shoot.
His class is what you make of it. You can get an A with light to moderate work.

Great teacher!!! Very straight forward, no BS kind of guy.  I wouldn't say he is the most approachable guy but he is very clear in class so it doesn't matter.  If you get an 89.99999 it's a B, no exceptions (which is fair).  He works hard to make a boring subject tolerable and leans heavily on the calculator.

GREAT TEACHER I like finance a lot considering it's my major and he made me like it even more. Very helpful and really down to earth. The class was pretty tough but definitely manageable! Go over the slides, read a little of book, go to class and you'll get an A. TAKE HIM
Great Professor! Easy going! Really Helpful! I recommend this class to all the students who will take FIN 3100.

i never write reviews for professors but i just had to write one for dr. bray. he is a great professor who gets right down to the point. he also gives real life examples so it's applicable to our own lives. i hate, hate, HATE, finance, but he somehow managed to change my views on that with this course. i highly recommend taking him, he's awesome!
Fantastic professor! Makes the class enjoyable ? just show up and he will teach you everything you will need for the exams/quizzes and you will pass.

Great professor who lays out what he expects from students from the get-go. He doesn't tolerate unprofessionalism, which includes talking in class and using cellphones. He explains things thoroughly and is very helpful outside of class. Plus he's pretty good looking and his biceps help distract from such boring course material.

One of the best teachers I've had at Kennesaw. I can definitely say I learned more in this class than any other upper level fiance class. Down to earth and keeps class interesting. Attend class and be on time if you want all the professionalism points. 4 test(25 multiple choice) and 5 quizzes. Tests are all curved to bring the avg up to a mid C.

Dr. Bray is very knowledgeable in finance and very fair with his student. He sets up the expectations right from the beginning of the semester to ensure there are no surprises. He will provide additional support and if needed will consider accommodations. He brings to class current real life examples, which makes it more interesting.

Bray is a very cool, no bull kinda guy. Don't listen to the last comment, paying attention in class will not suffice. This class can be tough. Do a lot of reading/studying the text on your own time. I made an A and really enjoyed the class and his style. The test averages very generally too low for his liking so he curved them. I highly recommend.

He's definitely not boring, which is great because finance is not my favorite. We had quizzes and tests which made up our grades. He let's you make a note card you can use on exams which is extremely helpful. Pay attention in class and you will know everything you need. I recommend him.  He's a cool guy!

I really could care less about finance before this class but I actually understood the material after he taught it and I was able to use it outside of class. He is a great teacher who I would recommend to anyone.

Great guy.  He is very accommodating if you attend classes and participate.  I never bought the book and just used the 8'x5' note card he allows and got an A.  He tries to come off as a sarcastic person but he is actually very kind and will meet with you about any topic if you ask.  Go Gators.
Good professor, down to earth. Has a take no crap attitude, but likes to have a couple of laughs during class too.
Great prof and great material. You can easily make A in his class if you spend time reviewing his slides and problems.Exams multiple choice questions and pretty straightforward.

Dr. Bray does a good job staying on topic and covering the materials.  He does not give projects, which is a huge plus for me.  Still, he does give 4 exams, so the class is hardly a cakewalk.  Come to every class, and be prepared to spend time outside of class studying the material and you'll do fine.

Prof Bray is a knowledgeable professor and an expert in the field of Finance.  If you enjoy learning Finance, there is no better professor at KSU.  I have found Investment Analysis to be one of my favorite courses in the MBA program.  Although the text is a little expensive, it is well crafted and you will find it an invaluable tool for many years.
